page.title: 02HISTORY AT HIGH DOWN HOUSE
page.content: I took four boys to visit High Down on June 8,1985.We were made very welcome and shown into the sitting room.The owners answered our questions and gave us a brief history of the place. It is c.1603 and was builtfor the son ofThomas Dowcra on his marriage to Jane Perriam.The last heir,female,sold the house on her marriage.It went to Ralph Ratcliffe,owner of Hitchin Priory,a wealthy merchant in the Lavant trade.He bought it as a Dowr House.The Radcliffes married into the Delme family and the present owner is a direct descendant.He rented High Down in 1955 and bought it in 1972. He hopes his two sons will inherit it. We saw the basement,which had been the kitchins.In a cupboard was an entrance for an old passage-an ascape for priests long ago?The boys explored the tunnel,entering from the courtyard.
